creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings: Bottom right, in black ink: WHC [Lugt 2626, W.H. Carpenter]
inscribed: Engraved in plate at bottom, in two columns with two lines: Ecco il belveder! ô che felice sorte! | Che la fruttifera in ventre porte. || Ma ch'ella porte, ô me; vita et morte piano | Demonstra l'arte del magno Titiano.; below: Al molto illustre, magnifico et offerunadis.mo Sig.r il SIG.R LUCA VAN UFFEL, in segno d'affectione et inclinatione | amoreuole, com Patrone et singularis.mo amico suo dedicato il vero ritratto del unico Titiano Ant. van Dyck.

displaymaker: Anthony van Dyck, 1599–1641; born Antwerp, Belgium; died London, England | Lucas Vorsterman the Elder, 1595–1675; born Zaltbommel, Netherlands; died Antwerp, England; active England | after Titian, 1480/90–1576; born Pieve di Cadore, Italy; died Venice, Italy
caption: Anthony van Dyck (1599–1641; born Antwerp, Belgium; died London, England), Lucas Vorsterman the Elder (1595–1675; born Zaltbommel, Netherlands; died Antwerp, England; active England), after Titian (1480/90–1576; born Pieve di Cadore, Italy; died Venice, Italy), Titian and His Mistress, 1630–1640. Etching and engraving; 29.8 x 23 cm (plate), 32 x 24.9 cm (sheet). Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888 (x1934-1251)
